author: marekm3498
content:
What do client teams think about extending engine_getPayloadBodies...V1 versus adding new methods engine_getPayloadBodies...V2? https://github.com/ethereum/execution-apis/pull/545

I think extending fields will be better without a new version. We implemented V2 for now

author: tersec
content: One concern with the merged/extended method is that it means the response type has to be kind of a union type otherwise -- sometimes `ExecutionPayloadBodyV2`, sometimes `ExecutionPayloadBodyV1`. this is a mess to decode on the CL side in terms of intertwining validation and parsing. there's some sense in which this has to happen regardless with any format, and there's a reason people suggest "parse, don't validate"; also, though, it creates code littered with "if in_some_fork: check for existence of this field; otherwise check for nonexistence" which is otherwise handled transparently at JSON serialization layer

author: tersec
content: doing this with `getPayloadV2` was IMO a mistake in this way and one reason I'm looking forward to dropping it from Nimbus when I feel comfortable dropping the ability to propose blocks in bellatrix/capella gossip
